ing: 4 1/2 pounds bone-in pork loin end roast
salt and ground black pepper to taste
1/2 (18 ounce) bottle hickory brown sugar barbeque sauce
3 tablespoons brown sugar, or to taste
des: "This is one of the easiest pulled pork recipes I've made. Since my husband was from 'south of the Mason-Dixon line' and raved about pulled pork in Virginia/South Carolina, I had a tough job ahead of me, but he loved it (!) so I guess I passed the test."
ins:
Arrange onion slices in the bottom of a slow cooker. Season pork with salt and pepper and place over onion. Add vinegar and water.
Cook pork on Low for 8 hours. Transfer pork to a platter and shred with two forks. Remove and discard about half the pork juices from slow cooker and stir in shredded pork, barbeque sauce, and brown sugar.
